ygData.messageBody:
> work without you worrying about it? For me, the choice is clear -- damage
> shields all the way.

Completely agreed. Problem is, Brian just said a few emails ago that it made
us too powerful. I would gladly give up my pet for a damage shield, however,
and I'm not sure that this would really make us overpowerful. What it would
mean is that we could use our spell in place we could never have used our
pet previously because of drawing puny creatures to fight, etc. I rarely use
my pet anymore except when soloing, so what is the point of it? (other than
to serve as a reason to have voice graft! :D). Damage shields would be
something effective for a GROUP situation and something that can actually be
used. What about a line of damage shields ... maybe every other level, and
then the pet spells on other levels replaced with ... something. Still
thinking on this one, but damage shields definitely would seem to be the way
to go if they could be implemented without overbalancing us. (Heck, I
*guess* I would agree to this even knowing my voice graft would be taken
away!) And this does fit in character with a SK, I think, almost as well as
lifetaps. Having people take damage just from hitting us ... sounds like
something I could easily imagine happening with a Shadowknight.

Oh, and as a sidenote ... I rarely rarely experience damage shields since
most other damage shield having classing are by default "good" races or
classes and I'll be damned if I'm going to fight with a druid. My magician
friend casts it on me at times, but that is rare because we don't group too
much anymore (surprise, he's pulling ahead of me in levels).

virten
